item.title: Cannot see if traffic com8ng towards driveway so unable to know when to pull off driveway safely. The bottom foliage, growing from the bottom of the tree needs removing. Situation even worse with only a single lane to use due to installation of cycle path., 24th October

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Public footpath non existant, 24th October
item.description:
According to the GCC website, footpath USRN 40102448 passes through the Archway indicated on the attached screenshot. I would like clarification if this path actually exists as the entrance is sometimes gated and there is no direct egress to the road at the rear. I have raised this with GEOplaces who have contacted GCC and been advised that it is an extant path maintained at the Public expense.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Depressing spanning Hatherley Road, 24th October
item.description:
The depression (2 inch drop, see photo) is the result of a backfilling of a trench that has now sunk. This drop in height means that HGVs and buses are now generating regular and severe vibrations to our property with visible damage (see attached photos), and more distressingly, waking us and our 2 year old children up regularly through the night (every 20minutes from approximately 3.40am every morning). As a full-time teacher with a young family, this is unsustainable. The depression spans the full width of the road and is situated near the entrance to Hatherley Gate. It is very obvious.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Drain, 24th October
item.description:
I reported the blocked drain outside 21 Beverley Gardens, Report 22061142. This report was closed as the gully crew carried out their annual gully clean on 23 August 2024. I spoke to the crew at the time and advised that this gully was blocked and they said it would be attended to. Their efforts have not unblocked the drain. A very light shower results in it filling and a stream starting down the road to the next working drain. It then takes 2 or 3 days for the sitting water on the road around the drain to clear. The photo was taken on 27 September, a month after the annual gully crew clearance activity.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beverley Gardens, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
